response.summary: Systems Engineer with a Master degree on Systems Engineering and Computing. Experience working with HTC and HPC systems involving scalable architectures on grid and cloud computing environments. Development skills on Bash, Python, Java, C/C++ and CUDA-C. Experience working with web development frameworks based on MVC architectures. Extensive knowledge on Linux operating systems. Experience working in development teams and using code control version systems.
response.skills: Investigación, Ciencias, Programación, Python, Linux, Bases de datos, Informática paralela, Java, C++, CUDA, Git, Cloud Computing IaaS, Heroku, Bash, Django

profile_positions.description:
► Monitoring and operation of large-scale processing of high energy physics data for the CMS experiment.
► Debugging and troubleshooting of the python software in charge of distributing and processing data obtained from the Large Hadron Collider.
► Ensure the correct deployment of the worker nodes in charge of the data processing in the OpenStack infrastructure.
► Monitoring of the health status of the Condor queue system in charge of submit jobs to the grid.
► Managing the Scientific Linux master nodes running the CMS project processing software.
profile_positions.title: Tier0 Operator

profile_positions.description:
► Design, development and deployment of a web-based Chemical Risk Map to provide a monitoring and warning solution for local authorities use in Medellín, Colombia.
► Configuring the ArcGis services in charge of provide the geographical information related to infrastructure, population, natural environment and chemical risks in Medellín, Colombia.
► Guidance during the development process to Computer Science students who were part the project.
► Bridge communication between the Chemical Engineering team and the Software Development team.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.description:
► Development of the back-end REST services of the Colombian Data Cube, a system to store, normalize and process satellite images of the country.
► Development of python and bash utilities to clean the system and maintain its integrity.
profile_positions.title: Research Graduate Assistant (Master's Programme)

company.name: Picnic Technologies
company.description:
At Picnic, we’re revolutionizing the way people buy groceries. Our affordable and sustainable service is made possible by our passionate people, cutting-edge technology, efficient planning, and, of course, our fleet of iconic electric vehicles! It’s why our customer base is growing rapidly across the Netherlands, Germany, and France.

One of the things that makes Picnic different is that we handle almost everything in-house: forecasting, developing our first automated warehouse and new electric Picnic vehicles, internal and customer-facing applications—the list goes on. It gives us more freedom when it comes to trying out new and innovative ideas, which is something we do a lot!

We love to challenge ourselves and learn new things. Our teams have access to various meetups, language classes, ‘Lunch & Learn’ sessions, our very own Tech Academy, and tailored soft-skills training. Professional development is as important to us as the service we provide to our customers.

As a diverse team made up of over 80 nationalities, there are always plenty of activities to get involved with, whether you’re into sports, board games, charitable causes, dancing (at our legendary Picnic festival), or licorice tasting—yes, even that!

Our scale-up culture means you get to own your role and bring fresh ideas to the table. So, if you’re looking for an opportunity to make a real difference, get in touch—we’d love to hear from you.
